news.Title: Commentary: Spotify algorithms aren't just predicting your music taste — they're shaping it
news.Description: The focus of streaming algorithms isn’t necessarily upon accurately predicting taste, but on trying to predict things like attention or engagement.
news.Summary: Even something as seemingly personal as music taste is transformed by the way these platforms intervene. If you use data to analyse and predict an individual’s music taste, then you will inevitably have some impact on them.

news.Title: HK DJ Eric Cheng, 56, dies 2 days after announcing engagement to longtime girlfriend
news.Description: The sad news comes as a shock to many, and reasons for his sudden death is still under investigation.
news.Summary: Hong Kong veteran radio deejay and actor Eric Cheng died on Feb 3 at the age of 56. His death came just two days after he shared news of his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, former Hong Kong national team roller skater, Wang Yanzhi.

news.Title: Ex-owner of popular Japanese buffet chain now hawker selling ayam buah keluak and rendang from S$6
news.Description: The 54-year-old hand-makes all the rempahs using her Peranakan granny’s recipes.
news.Summary: Nana Nonya, a new stall at Buangkok Hawker Centre (located within Sengkang Grand Mall) that opened last November. The joint specialises in homestyle Nonya dishes including beef rendang, ayam buah keluak and dry laksa, with mains starting from $6.

news.Title: Australia tells China of 'outrage' over writer's suspended death sentence
news.Description: SYDNEY — Australia has told China of its "outrage" over a suspended death sentence handed to Chinese-Australian dissident writer Yang Hengjun, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Tuesday (Feb 6).
news.Summary: Yang was sentenced to death on Monday with a two-year suspended execution and had all of his property confiscated, the Chinese foreign ministry said. Yang's sentence may be commuted to life imprisonment if no "serious crimes" are committed during the two-year suspension period, the Australian foreign ministry has said.

news.Title: TVB’s ‘go-to Caucasian actor’ Gregory Charles Rivers dies at 58 from apparent suicide
news.Description: The second of two unfortunate deaths in Hong Kong’s showbiz industry this past weekend.
news.Summary: The police discovered burnt coal in the room upon their arrival, and Gregory was pronounced dead on the scene. In 2017, Gregory beat skin cancer, only to be diagnosed with arrhythmia the year after.

news.Title: Thailand confident aid effort will lead to Myanmar crisis dialogue
news.Description: BANGKOK — A new Thailand-led humanitarian initiative aims to pave the way for talks between warring camps in military-ruled Myanmar, a senior Thai official said, three years after a coup triggered instability and a wave of violence across the country.
news.Summary: BANGKOK — A new Thailand-led humanitarian initiative aims to pave the way for talks between warring camps in military-ruled Myanmar, a senior Thai official said, three years after a coup triggered instability and a wave of violence across the country. Thailand plans to establish a humanitarian safe zone later this month at its border with Myanmar, near the Mae Sot-Myawaddy crossing, to deliver food and medical supplies to local communities and 20,000 people displaced by fighting, said Sihasak Phuangketkeow, Thailand's vice foreign minister.

news.Title: UN chief names independent panel to assess UNRWA agency in Gaza
news.Description: NEW YORK — United Nations (UN) chief Antonio Guterres announced on Monday (Feb 5) the creation of an independent panel to assess UNRWA, its embattled agency tasked with helping Palestinian refugees.
news.Summary: NEW YORK — United Nations (UN) chief Antonio Guterres announced on Monday (Feb 5) the creation of an independent panel to assess UNRWA, its embattled agency tasked with helping Palestinian refugees. UNRWA is under fire over accusations by Israel that 12 staff members were involved in the Hamas attack on Israel on Oct 7.

news.Title: Deadly California atmospheric river storm triggers flooding, power outages
news.Description: LOS ANGELES — A deadly Pacific storm, the second "Pineapple Express" to sweep the West Coast in less than a week, stalled over Southern California on Monday (Feb 5), unleashing torrential downpours that triggered street flooding and mudslides throughout the region.
news.Summary: Extreme-weather advisories for floods, high wind and winter storm conditions were posted on Monday across parts of California and southwestern Arizona where some 35 million people live. The NWS said more than 25.4cm of rain had fallen since Sunday across the Los Angeles area, the nation's second-largest city, with much more expected before showers were due to taper off on Tuesday.

news.Title: Red Bull investigate team boss Horner over allegations of 'inappropriate behaviour'
news.Description: LONDON — Red Bull Formula One team boss Christian Horner is under investigation following an accusation of "inappropriate behaviour".
news.Summary: LONDON — Red Bull Formula One team boss Christian Horner is under investigation following an accusation of "inappropriate behaviour". Horner, 50, who has been Red Bull team principal since 2005, strongly rejects the accusation.

news.Title: Safeguards for minors, vulnerable persons undergoing forensic medical checks with new changes to law: Parliament
news.Description: SINGAPORE — Forensic medical examinations will be conducted on victims without their consent only under "exceptional circumstances", such as if they are in a coma and have no authorised decision-maker to give consent.
news.Summary: Addressing questions from Members of Parliament (MP) about such examinations, Ms Rahayu Mahzam, Senior Parliamentary Secretary for Law, said that safeguards will be in place, such as having trusted persons accompany vulnerable victims and suspects, as well as specially trained officers conducting such examinations. The changes to the law also give the police the power to compel a person to undergo a forensic medical examination, by making it an offence should a suspect not comply with such an order.

news.Title: UK's King Charles III diagnosed with cancer
news.Description: LONDON — King Charles III has been diagnosed with cancer and has begun treatment, Buckingham Palace said on Monday (Feb 5), just a week after he was discharged from hospital following prostate surgery.
news.Summary: LONDON — King Charles III has been diagnosed with cancer and has begun treatment, Buckingham Palace said on Monday (Feb 5), just a week after he was discharged from hospital following prostate surgery. Messages wishing King Charles a swift recovery flooded in following the shock statement from the palace.

news.Title: Philippine central bank reinforces hawkish stance despite slower inflation
news.Description: MANILA: The Philippine central bank reinforced its hawkish stance on Tuesday (Feb 6) despite slower annual inflation in January, as policymakers remain wary that the El Nino impact could lift consumer price growth above its target in the second quarter. The consumer price index rose 2.8 per cent in January
news.Summary: MANILA: The Philippine central bank reinforced its hawkish stance on Tuesday (Feb 6) despite slower annual inflation in January, as policymakers remain wary that the El Nino impact could lift consumer price growth above its target in the second quarter. That was below the 3.1 per cent forecast in a Reuters poll, and was the second consecutive month that the pace of price increases fell within the central bank's 2 per cent to 4 per cent target range.

news.Title: French farmers’ protests temporarily halted, as government announces new aid measures for agriculture sector
news.Description: The French farming community’s calls for action have also been echoed by fellow farmers in other European countries, such as Germany, Poland and Belgium.
news.Summary: Agriculture workers have been blockading the highways across France with tractors and trailers, bringing mainstream traffic to a halt as the farming protests continue. Farmers are campaigning against competition from cheap imports, red tape, high production costs, and price pressures from retailers.

news.Title: Budanov: Enigmatic Ukraine spy chief behind attacks inside Russia
news.Description: KYIV: Enigmatic and unflappable, spy chief Kyrylo Budanov has built up a legendary reputation in Ukraine with a series of daring operations against Russia. Referred to as the man "without a smile" by Ukrainian news outlet NV, the 38-year-old is credited with attacks in occupied areas and deep inside Russia
news.Summary: Referred to as the man "without a smile" by Ukrainian news outlet NV, the 38-year-old is credited with attacks in occupied areas and deep inside Russia. Budanov was unknown to the public when he was appointed to head of the GUR military intelligence service in August 2020.

news.Title: Taiwan ally Guatemala mulls commercial ties with China, foreign minister says
news.Description: GUATEMALA CITY: Guatemala is considering reaching out to develop formal trade ties with China, the Central American country's foreign minister told Reuters on Monday (Feb 5), although it plans to maintain its existing relations with Taiwan. The Central American country is one of a handful of Taiwan's remai
news.Summary: "We are going to continue working with Taiwan at the levels we have been doing," Foreign Minister Carlos Ramiro Martinez said in an interview. "But the president has pointed out that we cannot ignore the weight and power China represents."

news.Title: 'Kneading and rolling non-stop': Yvonne Lim's handmade CNY goodies for friends look gorgeous enough for sale
news.Description: Chinese New Year (CNY) is right around the corner and while some local celebrities are releasing their own line of snacks for sale, actress Yvonne Lim is baking goodies for her friends instead. "Anyone have CNY anxiety like me? Told myself to take a CNY break this year and not do anything, just rest… but I failed again when friends...
news.Summary: "Anyone have CNY anxiety like me? You put so much thought into the packaging!"

news.Title: Woman blasts cabby for refusing to let her child eat in taxi, gets called out for being 'entitled parent'
news.Description: A passenger's attempt to lambast a taxi driver who had stopped her child from eating on board backfired when netizens labelled her as "entitled" instead. In a post shared to Facebook page SG Road Vigilante last Sunday (Jan 4), the passenger blasted a "rude" ComfortDelGro cabby, whom she claimed was impatient and drove recklessly. The woman, who was not identified,...
news.Summary: In a post shared to Facebook page SG Road Vigilante last Sunday (Jan 4), the passenger blasted a "rude" ComfortDelGro cabby, whom she claimed was impatient and drove recklessly. "I don't allow my children to eat in cars too, you have to teach them this," responded the driver.

news.Title: Thailand clamps down on cheap copies of elephant, cat trousers from China
news.Description: The wide-legged pants are comfortable in hot weather and popular with foreigners. Read more at straitstimes.com.
news.Summary: BANGKOK – Thailand’s Commerce Minister Phumtham Wechayachai has instructed the Customs Department to come up with measures to stem the influx of cheap trousers with traditional Thai cat and elephant patterns. Mr Phumtham, who also holds the post of deputy prime minister, said the copied versions of the cat and elephant trousers from China did not sport the exact copyrighted patterns and were of far inferior quality.

news.Title: Forest fires kill 123 in Chile’s worst disaster since 2010 earthquake
news.Description: Hundreds of people are still missing, the authorities say. Read more at straitstimes.com.
news.Summary: The fires that gathered momentum on Feb 2 now menaced the outer edges of Vina del Mar and Valparaiso, two coastal cities popular with tourists. Drone footage filmed by Reuters in Vina del Mar area showed whole neighborhoods scorched, with residents rummaging through husks of burnt-out houses where corrugated iron roofs have collapsed.

news.Title: Icy weather impedes travellers in China home-bound for new year festivities
news.Description: BEIJING — Freezing rain, snow and ice have complicated the journey home for many in central and eastern China, as billions travel ahead of the Spring Festival in chilly weather that has swept through parts of the country during the past week. The central province of Hubei has been hit the hardest, with highways slowed to a crawl and trains...
news.Summary: The central province of Hubei has been hit the hardest, with highways slowed to a crawl and trains delayed or cancelled, leaving travellers stranded. Hundreds of trains have been delayed or suspended, and throngs of passengers stranded at railway stations in Wuhan, local media said.

news.Title: Girl sexually abused by all four older brothers continues to suffer from anxiety attacks
news.Description: A girl was sexually abused by all four of her older brothers over four years, when she was between eight and 12 years old. Read more at stomp.straitstimes.com
news.Summary: They comprise one count of aggravated sexual assault by penetration and six counts of outrage of modesty. Despite this, the accused in the present case went into the girls’ room to sexually assault the victim.

news.Title: Saltburn actor Jacob Elordi involved in police investigation after assault allegations
news.Description: The actor allegedly assaulted a radio producer in Australia.
news.Summary: Jacob Elordi is being accused of pushing an influencer against a wall and grabbing his throat. New South Wales Police said an investigation had been launched after a 32-year-old was allegedly assaulted by a 26-year-old, and Fox has now broken his silence on the alleged incident.

news.Title: Japan's December real wages, household spending fall again
news.Description: TOKYO: Japan's real wages fell for a 21st straight month though at a slower pace, while household spending dropped for a tenth consecutive month, showing that inflation outpaced wage recovery and continued to weigh on consumer spending. Japan's wage trend, along with inflation, is closely watched, with the
news.Summary: TOKYO: Japan's real wages fell for a 21st straight month though at a slower pace, while household spending dropped for a tenth consecutive month, showing that inflation outpaced wage recovery and continued to weigh on consumer spending. Inflation-adjusted real wages, a barometer of consumer purchasing power, fell 1.9 per cent in December from a year earlier, but the pace of the decline slowed from a revised 2.5 per cent drop in November, data from the labour ministry showed.

news.Title: ATP roundup: '22 Cordoba champ Albert Ramos-Vinolas advances
news.Description: Despite managing just one ace to his opponent's seven, Spain's Albert Ramos-Vinolas took down Argentina's Pedro Cachin 6-4, 3-6, 6-1 in the first round of the Cordoba (Argentina) Open on Monday.Ramos-Vinolas, though unseeded, won the Cordoba tournament in 2022 after getting to the final the previous ye
news.Summary: Despite managing just one ace to his opponent's seven, Spain's Albert Ramos-Vinolas took down Argentina's Pedro Cachin 6-4, 3-6, 6-1 in the first round of the Cordoba (Argentina) Open on Monday. Ramos-Vinolas, though unseeded, won the Cordoba tournament in 2022 after getting to the final the previous year.

news.Title: California rains: Good for drought, fuel for wildfires
news.Description: The atmospheric river that has inundated California is a mixed blessing, at once easing drought conditions and promoting threatened fish species while also nourishing the growth of
news.Summary: The atmospheric river that has inundated California is a mixed blessing, at once easing drought conditions and promoting threatened fish species while also nourishing the growth of vegetation that will eventually fuel future wildfires. After severe drought conditions for most of this century, California is forecast to have its second wet year in a row, though not quite as wet as the exceptional precipitation of a year ago.

news.Title: Police apologise in Canada hockey gang rape case
news.Description: LONDON: Canadian police confirmed Monday (Feb 5) charges against five current and former NHL players over an alleged 2018 gang rape, and apologized for the six years it took to investigate the accusations. The players, who were part of Canada's junior national ice hockey team at the time, each face one cou
news.Summary: LONDON: Canadian police confirmed Monday (Feb 5) charges against five current and former NHL players over an alleged 2018 gang rape, and apologized for the six years it took to investigate the accusations. The five players are accused of sexually assaulting a young woman at a London, Ontario hotel after a Hockey Canada gala in June 2018.

news.Title: Is dyeing your hair bad for your health?
news.Description: Temporary and semi-permanent hair dyes, which wash out over time, seem to be safer than permanent dyes. Read more at straitstimes.com.
news.Summary: Bur breast cancer does seem to be associated with permanent hair dye, Dr White said. This link between permanent hair dye and breast cancer risk in black women has been shown in other studies too.

news.Title: Grammy viewership jumps on night Taylor Swift sets record
news.Description: LOS ANGELES - Taylor Swift's record-setting night at the Grammys drew the largest audience for music's highest honors since a pre-pandemic show in 2020, broadcaster CBS said on Monday (Feb 5).Television viewership averaged roughly 16.9 million... - Read more at AsiaOne
news.Summary: LOS ANGELES - Taylor Swift's record-setting night at the Grammys drew the largest audience for music's highest honors since a pre-pandemic show in 2020, broadcaster CBS said on Monday (Feb 5). Television viewership averaged roughly 16.9 million people for the three-hour-plus ceremony shown live from Los Angeles, according to Nielsen data released by CBS.

news.Title: Philippine annual inflation at 2.8% in January
news.Description: MANILA: Philippine annual inflation increased at its slowest pace in over three years, reflecting lower food, utility and transport costs, data showed on Tuesday (Feb 6), likely easing pressure on the central bank to hike or keep interest rates elevated for longer. The consumer price index rose 2.8 per cen
news.Summary: The consumer price index rose 2.8 per cent in January, the least since October 2020, the Philippine Statistics Authority said. Core inflation, which strips out volatile food and energy costs, slowed to 3.8 per cent in January from 4.4 per cent in the previous month.

news.Title: Oil prices mostly flat as Blinken's Middle East visit assessed
news.Description: Oil prices were little moved in early trading on Tuesday, as market participants assessed a visit to the Middle East by U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken to discuss a ceasefire offer in the region. Blinken met Saudi Arabia's de-facto ruler on Monday. Palestinians hope the visit will clinch a truce be
news.Summary: The United States continued its campaign against Iran-backed Houthis in Yemen, whose attacks on shipping vessels have disrupted global oil trading routes. In Russia, two Ukrainian drones struck the largest oil refinery in the country's south on Saturday, a source in Kyiv told Reuters.
